member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.#ctor
member.summary: Initialises application, sets tooltip messages Creates a log file for debug and testing output

member.name: F:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.sensorA
member.summary: 4.1 Create two data structures using the LinkedList class. The data must be of type "double" The two LinkedLists are to be declared as global within the public partial class

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.LoadData
member.summary: 4.2 Create a method "LoadData" which will populate both LinkedLists. Declare an instance of the Galileo library in the method and create the appropriate loop construct to populate the two LinkedLists. The LinkedList size will be hardcoded to 400. Input parameters empty, return type void.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.ShowAllSensorData
member.summary: 4.3 Create a custom method called "ShowAllSensorData" which will display both LinkedLists in a ListView. The input parameters are empty and the return type is void.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.buttonLoad_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: 4.4 Create a button and associated click method that will call the LoadData and ShowAllSensorData methods

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.NumberOfNodes(System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double})
member.summary: 4.5 Create a method called “NumberOfNodes” that will return an integer which is the number of nodes(elements) in a LinkedList.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.DisplayListBoxData(System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double},System.Windows.Forms.ListBox)
member.summary: 4.6 Create a method called “DisplayListBoxData” that will display the content of a LinkedList inside the appropriate ListBox.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.SelectListBoxRange(System.Windows.Forms.ListBox,System.Int32)
member.summary: A method that highlights a range of ListBox Items +-2 from the given index

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.textBoxSearchA_KeyPress(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs)
member.summary: Code to ensure only numbers can be entered in the Search Target textboxes

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.ClearTextBoxes
member.summary: A method to clear all TextBoxes

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.EnableControls
member.summary: Buttons and textboxes are disabled by default for error trapping purposes and only enabled once data has been loaded

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.SelectionSort(System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double})
member.summary: 4.7 Create a method called “SelectionSort” which has a single input parameter of type LinkedList, while the calling code argument is the linkedlist name.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.InsertionSort(System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double})
member.summary: 4.8 Create a method called “InsertionSort” which has a single parameter of type LinkedList, while the calling code argument is the linkedlist name.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.BinarySearchIterative(System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: 4.9 Create a method called “BinarySearchIterative” which has the following four parameters: LinkedList, SearchValue, Minimum and Maximum. This method will return an integer of the linkedlist element from a successful search or the nearest neighbour value. The calling code argument is the linkedlist name, search value, minimum list size and the number of nodes in the list.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.BinarySearchRecursive(System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: 4.10 Create a method called “BinarySearchRecursive” which has the following four parameters: LinkedList, SearchValue, Minimum and Maximum. This method will return an integer of the linkedlist element from a successful search or the nearest neighbour value. The calling code argument is the linkedlist name, search value, minimum list size and the number of nodes in the list.

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.TimeSearchFunction(System.Func{System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.LinkedList{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A method that takes a Sort method as a parameter and times the duration taken, returning a Tuple containing the index returned by the sort method as Item 1 and a formatted string of the number of ticks as Item 2

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.buttonBinaryIterativeA_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: 4.11 Create four button click methods that will search the LinkedList for a value entered into a textbox on the form. The search code must check to ensure the data is sorted, then start a stopwatch before calling the search method. Once the search is complete the stopwatch will stop and the number of ticks will be displayed in a read only textbox. Finally, the code will call the “DisplayListboxData” method and highlight the appropriate number (or the next closest number).

member.name: M:DataProcessing.DataProcessing.buttonSelectionSortA_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: 4.12 Create four button click methods that will sort the LinkedList using the Selection and Insertion methods. The button method must start a stopwatch before calling the sort method. Once the sort is complete the stopwatch will stop and the number of milliseconds will be displayed in a read only textbox. Finally, the code will call the “ShowAllSensorData” method and “DisplayListboxData” for the appropriate sensor.
